title: ncurses and netcdf fails to build with syntax error on Cray
body:
### Summary

ncurses fails to build with syntax error on Cray

### Actual Result

```
$ spack install ncurses
==> pkgconf is already installed in /users/adamr/tmp/spack/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/gcc-7.1.0/pkgconf-1.3.10-uhipjojjl7jb2zoq5e3lbcd6fhmelmse
==> Installing ncurses
==> Error: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (<string>, line 476)
SyntaxError: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (<string>, line 476)

/users/adamr/tmp/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:683, in child_process:
     27    
     28                # build up some context from the offending package so we can
     29                # show that, too.
  >> 30                package_context = get_package_context(tb)
     31    
     32                build_log = None
     33                if hasattr(pkg, 'log_path'):
```

```
$ spack install netcdf %gcc@7.1.0
==> libsigsegv is already installed in /users/adamr/tmp/spack/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/gcc-7.1.0/libsigsegv-2.11-tatqezxww74hs74fsldkwvpy6kf5isjp
==> m4 is already installed in /users/adamr/tmp/spack/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/gcc-7.1.0/m4-1.4.18-uuicyh5c6ms2gfbfklywbkrqujjvepbe

==> pkgconf is already installed in /users/adamr/tmp/spack/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/gcc-7.1.0/pkgconf-1.3.10-uhipjojjl7jb2zoq5e3lbcd6fhmelmse
==> util-macros is already installed in /users/adamr/tmp/spack/opt/spack/cray-CNL-haswell/gcc-7.1.0/util-macros-1.19.1-exb3t3uusocfq3ou63vbscihaf2sq5i5

==> Error: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (<string>, line 476)
SyntaxError: SyntaxError: invalid syntax (<string>, line 476)

     27    
     28                # build up some context from the offending package so we can
     29                # show that, too.
  >> 30                package_context = get_package_context(tb)
     31

     33                if hasattr(pkg, 'log_path'):
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Well, I wanted to build the `meson` package, since it is missing on my data center. I pulled the recent Spack, and typed `spack install meson`. `ncurses` happen to be on of the first dependencies for the meson.

The problem persists on `gcc@4.9.3`, `gcc@7.1.0` and `gcc@5.3.0`.

The specs:

```
$ uname -r
4.4.74-92.38-default

$ lsb_release -a
LSB Version:	n/a
Distributor ID:	SUSE
Description:	SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP2
Release:	12.2
Codename:	n/a

$ python --version
Python 2.7.13
```
